div.p: Greetings. In recent days, Mr. Musculus wrote to me in these words: "At present, I wish to know from you whether it would be agreeable to you if you were transferred to Zofingen in the place of Mr. Georg; for he has been transferred to another church, and his position is vacant.

As soon as possible, let me know your decision; for this matter cannot endure delay," etc. Regarding this request from Musculus, I sincerely wish to hear your opinion; please inform me of it as soon as you can, dearest brother.

The bearer of this letter is traveling to Poland and stayed overnight with me; he seems to me to be very learned and very eager for the matters of Christ; receive him with your usual kindness towards travelers. Farewell, incomparable friend. Given at Lenzburg, September 16, 1553.
To the faithful servant of Christ, Mr. Heinrich Bullinger, old friend and dearest brother in Christ.
